bibl.title: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 8, 1902

div1.p: Mabel Lazear provides family news. Her pension bill needs only the president's signature to become official.

div1.head: Letter from Mabel H. Lazear to Charlotte C. Sweitzer, March 8, 1902
div1.opener:
notes -- We enjoyed your very good
description of Nell's Feats so much
Mar 8t 1902 2012 Broadway
love to Aunt Kate and a great
deal to you from the Babies
& Mabel.
Dear Baltimore Gammie-
div1.p:
Houston
talks so much about
Baltimore Gammie that
you have begun to be
known by that -- name.
I am writing to tell you how
sorry we all are that
you have been so ill.
And I want to thank you
for the New York Times
which I enjoy very much.
And Aunt Kate for the Sun
which I shall keep- I am
delighted that the University
is to have such beautiful
grounds-

The accounts of your storms
in Baltimore are positively frightful
We have had much more
rain than usual- But
the country is beautiful
I spent the other day in
Sausalito- It was glorious
all the fruit trees are
in bloom and the wild
flowers coming up-

Peggy is marching about
the room while I write
She talks quite a little
Houston amuses us very
much by talking about
his - conspenders'conspenders'- The
straps that hold up his
new over-hauls-

You have doubtless heard
that the pension has
passed the Senate and
HR
L
now only awaits the signature
of the President- It was
a most fortunate thing for
me that Mr Pillsbury could
go East when he did-
He spent one entire day
at the capitol- Soon as he
found there was some of
familiar he rushed around
to all the Senators he knew
to get there support.-

I hope by the time you
get this letter you will
have quite recovered.
I have so many letters to
send off I shall write only &
